test_cases.description: Create a new task with valid data and verify the task is persisted, task list is reloaded, and form is closed.
test_cases.name: create_task_successful

test_setup.given: A valid task form input is provided (e.g., title: 'Buy milk', description: 'Get 2 liters of milk'). The API and backend are available.
test_setup.then: api.createTask is called with correct data, the task list is reloaded (e.g., api.getTasks is called), and the form is closed.
test_setup.when: handleCreateTask is called with the valid input.

test_cases.description: API call to create a task fails (e.g., network error or backend error). The task list is not reloaded, and the form should not close.
test_cases.name: create_task_api_failure

test_setup.given: A valid task form input is provided. api.createTask returns an error (network failure or server error).
test_setup.then: The error is handled gracefully, the task list is not reloaded, and the form remains open with an error message shown to the user.
test_setup.when: handleCreateTask is called.

test_cases.description: Task is created successfully, but reloading the task list fails (e.g., network error on reload). The form should still close, but an error may be displayed.
test_cases.name: reload_task_list_failure

test_setup.given: A valid task form input is provided. api.createTask succeeds, but reloading the task list (api.getTasks) fails.
test_setup.then: The form closes, the user is notified that the task list failed to reload, and the UI remains stable.
test_setup.when: handleCreateTask is called.

test_cases.description: Attempt to create a task with an empty title. The API should not be called, and validation error should be shown.
test_cases.name: create_task_with_empty_title

test_setup.given: A task form input with an empty title and valid description is provided.
test_setup.then: api.createTask is not called, the form remains open, and a validation error is displayed to the user.
test_setup.when: handleCreateTask is called.

test_cases.description: Create a task with the minimal valid data (e.g., only required fields filled).
test_cases.name: create_task_with_minimal_input

test_setup.given: A task form input where only the required fields (e.g., title) are provided.
test_setup.then: api.createTask is called with minimal data, the task list is reloaded, and the form is closed.
test_setup.when: handleCreateTask is called.

test_cases.description: Create a task where the title and description fields are at their maximum allowed lengths.
test_cases.name: create_task_with_max_length_fields

test_setup.given: A task form input with title and description fields filled to their maximum allowed lengths (e.g., title: 'T.repeat(255)', description: 'T.repeat(1024)').
test_setup.then: api.createTask is called with max-length data, the task list is reloaded, and the form is closed.
test_setup.when: handleCreateTask is called.

test_cases.description: Attempt to create a task with a title that already exists. The API returns a duplicate error.
test_cases.name: create_task_with_duplicate_title

test_setup.given: A task form input with a title that matches an existing task. api.createTask returns a duplicate error.
test_setup.then: The error is displayed to the user, the form remains open, and the task list is not reloaded.
test_setup.when: handleCreateTask is called.

test_cases.description: User submits the form multiple times in quick succession; ensures no duplicate tasks are created and UI is stable.
test_cases.name: rapid_task_form_submissions

test_setup.given: User clicks the submit button multiple times rapidly with the same valid input.
test_setup.then: Only one API call is made (or duplicate submissions are prevented), and only one task is created. The form closes after the process.
test_setup.when: handleCreateTask is invoked multiple times in quick succession.

test_cases.description: Verify that after a successful task creation and task list reload, the task form is closed.

test_setup.given: A valid task form input is provided.
